It can be served on its own or alongside creamy spreads or fatty pieces of meat.Ingredients8 servings1½cups whole freekeh, rinsedKosher salt⅓cup fresh lemon juice¼cup extra-virgin olive oil2Tbsp. pomegranate molasses1small red onion, finely chopped1cup coarsely chopped parsley2cups quartered cherry tomatoes, divided3Tbsp. savory leaves and/or mustard flowers (optional)Ingredient InfoPomegranate molasses can be found at Middle Eastern markets, some supermarkets, and online.PreparationStep 1Cook freekeh in a large saucepan of simmering salted water until tender, 30–40 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking.Step 2Whisk lemon juice, oil, and pomegranate molasses in a large bowl. Add freekeh, onion, parsley, and two-thirds of cherry tomatoes; season with salt and toss to combine.Step 3Transfer salad to a platter and top with remaining tomatoes and savory leaves and/or mustard flowers, if using.Step 4Do Ahead: Salad (without savory and mustard flowers) can be made 6 hours ahead.
